channel.title: Error SetupArrayProps_R: array prop '(null)' is at index zero
channel.description:
Hello everyone, I'm new at hl2 mods, and I don't know exactly what to do when an issue comes up. So, the problem is, that whenever I start BM : S from Steam, it opens up and keeps loading, but, after 2~4 seconds it closes and a message pops up: "Engine Error: SetupArrayProps_R: array prop '(null)' is at index zero.". Well, that's it, I need so much help, I really want to play this game, reply as soon as you know how to fix this suffocating problem.
(I installed SDK Base 2007, changed appID to 218 (it was 218 anyways), restarted steam, reinstalled, deleted bin, download BM : S again, and I couldn't do more ...) Just to let y'all know ...
Thanks for reading.

item.title: Error SetupArrayProps_R: array prop '(null)' is at index zero
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Well, I believe that aforementioned problem has been solved. I’m going to go ahead and close this. If there are more problems like this in the future, please create a new thread.

Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Error SetupArrayProps_R: array prop '(null)' is at index zero
item.dc:creator: ztooner
item.description:
I Had 2 Source SDK 2007 Updates again today… first one was 16 mb… now i’m downloading another 600 mb. I hope this doesn’t screw anything again, is it safe to disable automatic updates on Source SDK 2007? (Since it’s keeps fixing what’s not broken) and also my bandwidth is a crap, so it takes a little too much time to download it.

Read full topic

item.title: Error SetupArrayProps_R: array prop '(null)' is at index zero
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
gemballa:

DO this

  1. Repair steam using elevated command prompt
  2. Reinstall BMS

Dont worry, your saved games will remain intact

Um, yeah, the issue is resolved. Valve released a patch for the SDK.

Read full topic

item.title: Error SetupArrayProps_R: array prop '(null)' is at index zero
item.dc:creator: gemballa
item.description:
Vaxing:

Hello everyone, I’m new at hl2 mods, and I don’t know exactly what to do when an issue comes up. So, the problem is, that whenever I start BM : S from Steam, it opens up and keeps loading, but, after 2~4 seconds it closes and a message pops up: “Engine Error: SetupArrayProps_R: array prop ‘(null)’ is at index zero.”.
Well, that’s it, I need so much help, I really want to play this game, reply as soon as you know how to fix this suffocating problem.

(I installed SDK Base 2007, changed appID to 218 (it was 218 anyways), restarted steam, reinstalled, deleted bin, download BM : S again, and I couldn’t do more …) Just to let y’all know …

Thanks for reading.

DO this

  1. Repair steam using elevated command prompt
  2. Reinstall BMS

Dont worry, your saved games will remain intact

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: aslanakbay
item.description:
Ben bu problemi çözdüm . bütün herşeyi silin (steam, half-life,regedit… hepsi) yeniden kurun upgrade etmeyin. modları oynayın.
(I fix that problem. delete every thing (steam, half-life, registry… all) than setup again but don’t upgrade. play mods.)

item.title: Error SetupArrayProps_R: array prop '(null)' is at index zero
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
You /should/ be able to just exit out of Steam and then restart. Alternatively, you can reboot your computer. Once everything updates, you should be good to go.

Read full topic

item.source: Error SetupArrayProps_R: array prop '(null)' is at index zero

item.title: Error SetupArrayProps_R: array prop '(null)' is at index zero
item.dc:creator: CodeKiller
item.description:
In fact you just need to delete all SDK* folders in your account folder in Steam.

Example :
H:\Steam\SteamApps%accountname%\source sdk base 2007

I had 2 folders, delete the 2, restart Steam, it will update the SDK.

Read full topic

You guys can’t imagine my happiness when i was able to see this screen again.

1920×1080 60.5 KB

item.title: Error SetupArrayProps_R: array prop '(null)' is at index zero
item.dc:creator: CAMILOSTATIS
item.description:
JamesLieko:

Alright guys: Right click Source SDK Base 2007, hit Preferences, then Betas, the Steampipe Beta in the drop down box.
Then try to verify file integrity. It will have it convert over to SteamPipe, after that is done Black Mesa will work again.

I can confirm that this worked.

Read full topic
item.source: Error SetupArrayProps_R: array prop '(null)' is at index zero

item.title: Error SetupArrayProps_R: array prop '(null)' is at index zero
item.dc:creator: MalueMan
item.description:
ztooner:

Currently Doing this. It says i have to download some more content (400 mb more) will inform how this goes, when download finishes.

It absolutely works, if you lose connection to steam and can’t seem to get onto the network RESTART your PC. You’ll be able to log in normally and continue with verifying file integrity. After that it’s all set!

Thanks again for the fix guys!

Read full topic
